2024 NJ S 3143
Author: Singer
Version: Introduced
Version Date: 05/06/2024

SENATE, No. 3143

STATE OF NEW JERSEY

221st LEGISLATURE

INTRODUCED MAY 6, 2024

Sponsored by:

Senator ROBERT W. SINGER

District 30 (Monmouth and Ocean)

Senator ANGELA V. MCKNIGHT

District 31 (Hudson)

Co-Sponsored by:

Senator Greenstein

SYNOPSIS

Requires hospitals and nursing homes to provide access to certain interpreter services for deaf and hard of hearing.

CURRENT VERSION OF TEXT

As introduced.

An Act concerning interpreter services and supplementing Title 26 of the Revised Statutes.

Be It Enacted by the Senate and General Assembly of the State of New Jersey:

1. a. Each hospital and nursing home licensed pursuant to P.L.1971, c.136 (C.26:2H-1 et seq.) shall make interpreter services for the deaf and hard of hearing available to patients 24 hours per day, seven days per week. Interpreter services shall include, at minimum, interpreter services provided through electronic means including, but not limited to, video remote interpreting services and artificial intelligence-assisted interpreting services, as approved by the Commissioner of Health.

2. This act shall take effect 180 days after the date of enactment.

STATEMENT

This bill requires each hospital and nursing home licensed pursuant to P.L.1971, c.136 (C.26:2H-1 et seq.) to make interpreter services for the deaf and hard of hearing available to patients 24 hours per day, seven days per week. Interpreter services will include, at minimum, interpreter services provided through electronic means including, but not limited to, video remote interpreting services and artificial intelligence-assisted interpreting services, as approved by the Commissioner of Health.

Senator Greenstein

SYNOPSIS

Requires hospitals and nursing homes to provide access to certain interpreter
services for deaf and hard of hearing.

CURRENT VERSION OF TEXT

As introduced.

An Act concerning interpreter services and supplementing Title 26 of the
Revised Statutes.

Be It Enacted by the Senate and General Assembly of the State of New Jersey:

1\. a. Each hospital and nursing home licensed pursuant to P.L.1971, c.136
(C.26:2H-1 et seq.) shall make interpreter services for the deaf and hard of
hearing available to patients 24 hours per day, seven days per week.
Interpreter services shall include, at minimum, interpreter services provided
through electronic means including, but not limited to, video remote
interpreting services and artificial intelligence-assisted interpreting
services, as approved by the Commissioner of Health.

2\. This act shall take effect 180 days after the date of enactment.

STATEMENT

This bill requires each hospital and nursing home licensed pursuant to
P.L.1971, c.136 (C.26:2H-1 et seq.) to make interpreter services for the deaf
and hard of hearing available to patients 24 hours per day, seven days per
week. Interpreter services will include, at minimum, interpreter services
provided through electronic means including, but not limited to, video remote
interpreting services and artificial intelligence-assisted interpreting
services, as approved by the Commissioner of Health.
